questions.question: What event earned Abu Bakr the title 'As-Siddiq' meaning 'The Truthful One'?
options: When he believed instantly in the Prophet's Night Journey while others mocked
When he became the first Caliph

questions.question: What major accomplishments did Abu Bakr achieve as the first Caliph?
options: He united Muslims during crisis, preserved the Quran, and expanded Islam
He established the first Islamic school

questions.question: What was Abu Bakr's special distinction in accepting Islam?
options: He was the first adult man to accept Islam
He was the youngest to accept Islam
He was the richest to accept Islam
He was the last to accept Islam

questions.question: According to the key lesson, what does true friendship with Allah's messenger require?
options: Believing, supporting, and sacrificing everything for Allah and His messenger

questions.question: What significant change occurred when Umar converted to Islam?
options: Islam gained strength and Muslims could finally pray openly at the Ka'bah
The Battle of Badr was won

questions.question: What does the key lesson teach about Umar's leadership?
options: True leadership combines strength with justice, and power with humility before Allah

questions.question: How did Umar deal with his hunger rather than use public funds meant for the poor?
options: He put pebbles in his mouth to forget hunger
He ate only once a day

questions.question: Who feared encountering Umar according to the lesson?
What special title did Uthman earn and why?
options: 'Possessor of Two Lights' because he married two daughters of the Prophet

questions.question: What generous act did Uthman do with a well during Muslim hardship?
options: He dug a new well for Muslims
He bought a well and made it free for all Muslims forever
He guarded the well from enemies

questions.question: How did Uthman die according to the lesson?
options: He was martyred while reading Quran, with blood staining the blessed pages

questions.question: What did the Prophet say about whoever equips the Army of Hardship?
What brave act did Ali perform on the night of Hijrah?
options: He escorted the Prophet to Madinah
He slept in the Prophet's bed while assassins surrounded the house, risking his life
He warned the Muslims about danger

questions.question: What was Ali's relationship to the Prophet?
options: He was the Prophet's cousin and among the first children to accept Islam
He was the Prophet's nephew only

questions.question: According to the hadith, how did the Prophet describe Ali's position to him?
options: Like Harun was to Musa, except there will be no prophet after me

questions.question: Who did Ali marry and what position did he later hold?
What sacrifice did Talhah make at the Battle of Uhud?
options: He used his body as a shield for the Prophet, receiving over seventy wounds
He carried the wounded to safety

questions.question: What did the Prophet say about Talhah on that day?
options: Paradise became obligatory for Talhah today

questions.question: How did Talhah demonstrate his generosity despite being wealthy?
options: He distributed his entire wealth to the poor, keeping nothing for himself

questions.question: Who invited Talhah to accept Islam early on?
At what age did Zubayr accept Islam?
How did Zubayr's uncle torture him to force him to renounce Islam?
options: By denying him food and water
By locking him in a dark room
By hanging him in smoke-filled mats

questions.question: What special title did the Prophet give to Zubayr?
options: His disciple, saying every prophet has a disciple and Zubayr was his

questions.question: Who did Zubayr marry?
When Abd al-Rahman migrated to Madinah with nothing, what did he request?
What massive donation did Abd al-Rahman make to the Muslim army?
options: An entire caravan of 700 camels loaded with supplies

questions.question: Despite his immense wealth, how did Abd al-Rahman live?
options: Simply, giving generously to widows, orphans, and the poor
In luxury but gave some charity

questions.question: According to the hadith, what is excellent for a righteous person?
What was Saad's response when his mother threatened to starve herself unless he renounced Islam?
options: He asked the Prophet for help
He tried to convince her gently
He remained firm and refused to abandon Islam

questions.question: What was Saad known as in defending Islam?
options: First to shoot an arrow defending Islam and a master archer

questions.question: What special quality did the Prophet mention about Saad's supplications?
What did the Prophet say to Saad at Uhud while giving him arrows?
options: May my parents be sacrificed for you

questions.question: When did Saeed accept Islam?
options: Before the Prophet even entered Dar al-Arqam to teach secretly

questions.question: How did Saeed and his wife Fatimah contribute to Umar's conversion?
options: When Umar struck his sister, their steadfastness helped lead to his conversion
They invited him to a feast
They gave him a copy of the Quran

questions.question: What happened when Saeed was falsely accused of stealing land?
options: He took the matter to court
He made a supplication that if the accuser was lying, Allah would blind her, and it came true
He proved his innocence with witnesses

questions.question: Which major battle did Saeed NOT participate in?
What was Abu Ubaydah's special title given by the Prophet?
options: The Trustworthy One of this Ummah

questions.question: What sacrifice did Abu Ubaydah make at the Battle of Uhud to help the Prophet?
options: He fought off ten enemies alone
He removed two rings from the Prophet's helmet with his teeth, losing two front teeth
He carried the Prophet to safety
He gave his shield to the Prophet

questions.question: How did Abu Ubaydah die?
options: He chose to stay with his people during a plague rather than escape, dying as a martyr

questions.question: According to the hadith, what did the Prophet say about Abu Ubaydah?
options: He will lead the greatest conquest
Every nation has a trustworthy person, and this nation's is Abu Ubaydah
